Title: Germany’s VNG signs mid-term gas supply deal with Sonatrach
Description: German energy company VNG has signed a deal with Algeria’s state-owned Sonatrach to buy natural gas, with the company becoming the first German company to do so.
Author: JS

Title: Croatia to construct two gas pipelines to boost capacity from expanding Krk LNG
Description: The Croatian government greenlighted plans to construct two natural gas pipelines for EUR400 million ($430 million) to boost deliveries to neighbouring Hungary and Slovenia and to accommodate the capacity increase at the country’s sole LNG terminal, the 2.1 mtpa Krk terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Argentina seeks tugboat, maritime services for Escobar, indicating upcoming LNG demand
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has issued one tender each to secure tugboat services and maritime agency services to support import operations at its 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG terminal, indicating plans to restart LNG imports for the year. Both tenders close on Feb. 22.
Author: CK

Title: Mid-Ocean Energy buys SK’s 20% share in Peru LNG, adding to its Australian LNG interests
Description: MidOcean Energy has agreed to buy SK Earthon’s 20% share in the Peru LNG as part of its strategy to create a global, diversified LNG portfolio.
Author: CK
